intro: Unonopsis spectabilis, commonly known as the showy unon, is a striking flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Its flowers are typically tubular and attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Unonopsis spectabilis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for tropical and subtropical landscapes.
